resources.string: 4- The school track is a rectangle with a perimeter of 200 meters. If one side of the track is 40 meters long, what is the length of the opposite side?
3- A square has all sides the same length. If the perimeter of a square is 36 cm, what is the length of each side of the square?
1- A rectangular swimming pool is 25 meters long. If the area of the pool is 300 sq m, what is the width of the pool?
2- A rectangular garden has a length of 15 meters and a width of 8 meters. What is the area of the garden in square meters?

A rectangle is a closed 2-D shape, having 4 sides, 4 corners, and 4 right angles (90°). The opposite sides of a rectangle are equal and parallel. Since, a rectangle is a 2-D shape, it is characterized by two dimensions, length, and width. Length is the longer side of the rectangle and width is the shorter side.
Rectangle being the most common shape forms a part of our day to day life. Some real-life examples of the rectangle are given below.
The properties of a rectangle are as given below:\n\n

1- It is a flat and closed shape.

2- It has 4 sides, 4 angles, and 4 corners (vertices). 

3- It has 2 dimensions, namely, length and width

Every angle of a rectangle measures 90°.

4- Opposite sides are equal and parallel.

5- It has 2 diagonals of equal length.
Area and Perimeter of a Rectangle
The space occupied by a rectangle is termed as its area. The area of a rectangle can be calculated by finding the product of its length and width. So,\n\nArea of a rectangle = Length × Width

The perimeter of a rectangle is the sum of the length of its four sides. Let’s find the formula for the perimeter of a rectangle.

Perimeter of a rectangle = length + width + length + width 

 = 2 × length + 2 × width

 = 2 (length + width)
